description: Meridian Hall (formerly the Sony Centre), Toronto's first performing arts centre and one of the largest theatres in Canada, has played a defining role in the cultural life of Toronto for more than 50 years. Today, Meridian Hall's mission is to unite the global citizens of Toronto through great artistic experiences. Meridian Hall presents year-round programming including concerts, musical theatre, gala and fundraisers, family entertainment, comedy, and dance. Meridian Hall has also recently introduced community classes ranging from yoga classes to art lessons. It is truly where the world comes to play!

reviews.title: Meridian TERRIBLE STAFF.
text: Wanda Sykes was amazing.  Hilarious.  No complaints.  The staff at Meridian was terrible.  We arrived early for the show, but still managed to be 35 minutes in line waiting for our phones to be put away in pouches. That was just the beginning of the unorganized chaos.  The opening act was already on stage while we looked for our seats.  Lights were off, no phones for flashlights, we couldn‚Äôt see anything. No clue where we were going.  Each entrance kept telling us that we were on the wrong side.  We were sent back and forth three times. The lady on the left hand side told me after we had been sent back to her entrance (which ended up being the right one on our third attempt) ‚Äúwell I don‚Äôt know what to tell you.  You might have to ask a few different people to find your seats‚Äù.  Not an usher inside to help.  We were a group of five wandering around frustrated and annoyed. When someone finally assisted us, of course there were people in our seats.  The usher walked away and just left us to deal with it.  Again no access to our phones for tickets, and no lights to confirm on the little hand written post it note we were given with our seat numbers.  We sat down with ten seconds to spare before Wanda came on and made us forget about the disaster‚Ä¶ until the end of the show.  Zero direction on where and how to take our phones out of the pouches. We were just rushed out onto the sidewalk and forced to find staff to do it..  NO ORGANIZATION OR ASSISTANCE YET AGAIN.  I‚Äôm not sure if they don‚Äôt have enough staff, but they definitely do not have helpful staff.  I will avoid ever going to an event here again.

reviews.title: not comfortable.
text: The primary thing I care about in a theater is the seat and these seats are old and dire need of being replaced.  Cushioning so crushed that you are just sitting on the metal bars under the seat pan....not comfortable.

reviews.title: Great Venue for Live Music
text: This is a great venue with wonderful acoustics and comfortable seats. Not a bad seat in the house. Easy to get to being close to Union Station

reviews.title: Dance program at the Meridian
text: Saw Alvin Ailey American Dance at Meridian Hall. The last time I saw them was in NYC in the late 70s. Great seats but the best aspect was being part of the appreciative audience!

reviews.title: Will never visit again
text: This is a review of the venue. My husband and I were so disappointed when we sat down in the auditorium to watch Lord Of The Rings, a 3.5 hour concert and had to leave at intermission. The seating was unbelievably tight, worse than coach airline seats or seats in the movie theatres. There was no room for people to pass to get to their seat, even if you‚Äôre standing. This seating would be good for the hobbits but that‚Äôs about it. If you are tall or fluffy (larger than size 12) then I do not recommend.

reviews.title: Sort Yourself Out
text: This is a review of the venue, not one of my favourite bands, Porcupine Tree. While the venue is modern and comfortable with a civilized bar area, the staff did not respect the wishes of the band nor the audience.

This was a heavy hard rock alternative band who wanted the audience to stand up, appreciate them by showing enthusiasm and evoke some energy. The band repeated asked us to stand up and show them that Toronto had some life. We were repeatedly told to sit down and actually told we would be thrown out if we stood up! We were treated like petulant school children and talked down to by rude security staff. We waited a decade for this band to perform together again and the evening was tainted by this venue and their ignorant security staff.
Know your audience. Listen to the artists. Stop being overbearing control-freaks if you want people to enjoy being entertained here!

reviews.title: Warning: Not for tall people.
text: No tall people allowed.
The leg room is not made for tall people. Thanks to a great angle of the seat. And to top it of they block a part with cup holder.
A warning would have been nice.

reviews.title: Attended the Dream Theater concert
text: Went there on the 2nd March 2022.
Great venue in walking distance from the hotel
Easy access to refreshments and amenities.
Seats great. You can see the whole stage.
Will be back hopefully for more concerts.

reviews.title: Good viewing from anywhere in this theatre
text: Good location,easy to access from gardener express,parking  close by ,excellent service and food was good and reasonably priced

reviews.title: Drum Tao
text: My husband and I went to see the Drum Tao show last week.  It was a great show!  We sat in the second last row of the theatre and we did not have any problems with our view or the sound!  If you had a very tall person sitting right in front of you, you could have an issue with part of your view being blocked...but we were fine.

Before the show we had a bite to eat at Scotland Yard which is a 5 minute walk away.  There are alot of good restaurants to choose from which are about a 5 or 10 minute walk away!  We drove down and parked in the Green P parking lot - again, very close.  After 6:00 pm, it's only $7 to park!
The location is good for public transit as well - Union station is very close.
I haven't been here in years to see a show!  I would definately come back.

reviews.title: Poor Security Prep
text: I‚Äôve been to the Sony Centre many times for anything from a rock concert, comedy show, film with orchestra or most recently the Tenors Christmas show.  The theatre itself is pretty decent - sound is good, sight lines also decent considering its size.

But the pre-show security checks are so poorly handled, you really need to think hard when selecting the Sony.  For the Tenors show, we arrived 30 mins before the show and were greeted with a line that snaked from the main entrance on front - west to Yonge and south on Yonge towards the back of the theatre.  My wife checked if there was another way in, and nope - same scene to the east where the line snaked on itself for blocks to the East.
As a result, we were unable to gain access to the theatre until 8pm and the show had to start at 820 given all the people still waiting outside.

This should be fairly basic capacity planning - there are no metal detector machines, just people with wands - and given there are lots more doors available than they were using, this did not need to be the experience.  I‚Äôm all for security and happy to be checked - but when you know there will be a full house, there has to be a way for additional security to assist in moving things along.

reviews.title: Great concert hall
text: Went to see John Prine and had a great evening, the seats are comfortable and the concert hall has great view of the stage no matter where you sit,

reviews.title: Absolutely pitiful customer service
text: I explain to the agent that I want to exchange tickets for two next to one another. Transferred to an agent specialized in tickets. 15 minutes later I explain my request to another agent. Transferred to an agent in Canada. 15 minutes later, I explain my request to (an extremely rude) third agent. After 15 minutes spent finding appropriate seats, agent explains to me that tickets CANNOT BE EXCHANGED. 45-minute phonecall producing ZERO results.

reviews.title: Fall for Dance North
text: My senior group got lucky.  We found a great event at The Sony while we were in town for a trip.  They got to enjoy dance from around the world and really loved taking drinks to their seats.  I would like the opportunity to come back and see another production at The Sony.

reviews.title: Venue is blah and issues with sound quality
text: Saw Kamasi Washington concert here and the concert started at 8:00pm and the musicians were still doing sound checks right up until close to 8:00pm, so we did not get in to get seated until 7:50pm, not the venues fault, but it seems to be a common theme in some of the poor reviews of having to wait until the concert actually starts to get your seat.... Sounds quality was also an issue, not sure who was in charge of the sound, but the opening act had some issues and at one point in time someone from back stage came out and adjusted a microphone on stage which seemed to clear up the weird noise, then the main act, Kamasi Washington, was way too loud, again not sure if it was the venue or the musicians and their people who decided on the volume.  The venue itself is really showing its age as well with tight seating and old decor that is starting to fall apart in some areas.  The least favourite venue I have been to for a concert/show.  The music from the concert was really good, just very loud as stated above.

reviews.title: Wiggles were amazing but...
text: Went to see the Wiggles with my 14 month old son, I had to pay for 2 seats. We walked in and had to wait for the doors to open to find our seats. Once they opened there was no one directing or helping anyone find there seats. So ai went from one end to another before I found them. We sat down and when the performance started my son sat in my lap which meant his seat was open. A few minutes in a couple came with there son and he asked me to move my bag from the seat I paid for, I said why, he then tells me that the seats he paid for someone else was occupying and the usher told him to sit in my seat. I am sorry but if my son decided to sit on his own he couldn‚Äôt.

I would like a full refund for my seat as I wasn‚Äôt able to use it and I want the Ushers to do there job and help the people find there righht seats instead of putting people where there are empty seats. I will never come back to this place ever again no matter who is performing

reviews.title: Concert
text: Performance Simple Minds wonderful concert, same voice,very nice friendly singer. So happy to be here.

reviews.title: Came to see Seth Myers
text: The venue is excellent.
There's really no bad seats.
Sound is really good.
Overall just a really good venue to see a show.
Of course I will be back again!

reviews.title: Great jazz concert venue
text: This was a great spot to catch a Concert .
Beer or wine can be purchased and taken to your seat! Great friendly staff.

reviews.title: Nice venue for comedy
text: Went to Steve Martin and Martin Short for a night of comedy. Seats were not to bad for sitting for two hours. Sound was pretty good when they did their routines and when the band was playing. They have alcohol you can take to your seats. Nice location right down by the financial district across from the hockey hall of fame. Plenty of parking all around. Enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Needs a new PA
text: The show itself was great, but the PA could not handle it. No bass or bass drum for a prog rock show. Husband is in the audio business and said the Adamson rig they have is not good enough to support a big show like that. He said he would not return to the venue for a show, because the sound quality from the rig was so poor. That being said - the seats were comfortable, the lines to get drinks were short and efficient. Bathrooms were nice.

reviews.title: Venue Review
text: Having read several reviews of the venue prior to our visit, I was full of trepidation; here is my take on our recent visit.

We made  late booking so did not have the best seats and as several reviewers had commented on the comfort, or lack, of the seats we were a little concerned. I will agree that if you have freakishly long legs or have made more visits to MacDonalds than is prudent you .at experience  some discomfort, but if you have a normal human-sized body all is well!
The acoustics are good,  the sight line from our less expensive seats was good and yes  the seats are relatively comfortable.
As with life  nothing is perfect, bit I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Sony Centre.

reviews.title: Mariah Carey Show
text: The venue - fine, except the extraordinary line up to get in, chaotic people budding in line and several smoking up totally unacceptable
Emails to the Sony centre and ticketron go unanswered
Mariah Carey - if free would not go again, sorry but the time for divas is over.
Having patrons wait 90 minutes to start your 8:00 show not acceptable

reviews.title: Sarah Brightman Concert at Sony Centre, Toronto.
text: Sony Centre is located in downtown Toronto and has been around for a few decades. They have recently installed an amazing sound system, better than that of Roy Thomson Hall. I attended the Sarah Brightman Concert in February 10, 2019. Joining her was a 30 person choir and a 30 piece orchestra. Her voice was stronger and more confident than when I saw her many years ago. She sang many songs from her new album 'Hymn' which I was not familiar with. She also sang a number of popular songs: 'Stranger in paradise, Time to say goodbye, Phantom of the opera and a selection from the Planets by Holst. The concert was an enjoyable experience.

reviews.title: Review of the venue, NOT the show
text: This place is ridiculous...  but before I get too into it I DO want to compliment the staff. The ones who ARE there are friendly and well trained.
Now on the venue itself.
Looks great when you walk in, soon notice many oversights that lead to gatherings and lines blocking any easy passage to seats or amenities.

The lines for merchandise are easily 15 minutes long. The line to concessions is a good 8 to 10 minutes. This is easily fixed through hiring more employees to help lines move faster. There should also be employees directing people to where lines end and which line they're looking for instead of the current free for all.

Well the above may be easily fixed, the seats which are absolutely ridiculously cramped would not be. However based on the multitude of reviews stating the obvious regarding the brutal seats and crampedness of said seats it's definitely in their best interest to redo the entire auditorium for the sake of venue goers. I for one cant see myself attending another show with seating such as this.

reviews.title: wonderful performance, dreary, dated and cramped venue
text: First the good part - a wonderful performance of Amadeus with an excellent orchestra.
But the lobby areas are shabby and bereft of any d√©cor. Bare walls, sad little seating areas that reminded me of a church basement.
Acoustics are excellent,seating looks relatively new. And also looks like they crammed in more seats!
Very uncomfortable and I am not big

reviews.title: Trevor Noah
text: Saw Trevor Noah here in January.  Excellent venue for smaller audiences.   Location is great - we were able to street park nearby, dine and make the show with plenty of time to spare.

reviews.title: Decent venue but awful seatsü§Æ
text: Went to see Trevor Noah and the room is great for standup (plus he is freaking hilarious). However, the seating is awful with leg room seriously inadequate.

Listen, I get that I am pretty tall at 6'4" but my knees should not be encroaching into both neighbours leg space. $100+ tickets should not have someone be uncomfortable the whole show and not feeling their legs by the end. I was wedged in the whole time.

I realise it'll probably never change but it will be a main factor in my decisions for future events at the Sony Centre, sadly. Sorry for the negative two star review as it is a pretty decent venue, overall.
Cheers

reviews.title: Great accoustics, comfortable seats
text: We attended the 2pm Nutcracker Ballet presentation on Dec. 22.
The seats we reserved where located in the third row from the back, to the side. In spite of this we could watch the stage perfectly well!

reviews.title: We will rock you...
text: We recently saw "We will rock you" at the Meridian Hall. The acoustics were great but our sightlines weren't that good. We had seats near the back of the hall and with 2 tall people sitting in front of us we had to look between them to see the show which was uncomfortable. Also charging $13 for a can of beer was kind of steep. Other than that we enjoyed the show.

reviews.title: One playing the number ones of the Beatles.
text: Two reviews in one! The theatre itself has been around for almost 70 years, but the seats are comfy and roomy and the theatre is not showing wear and tear. Acoustics were surprisingly not great. May be a function of the sound engineer for the band. Drums were inaudible during the first half. Sound was muddy.
Washrooms were very limited, considering the size of the venue.
The band itself did faithfully reproduce the hits of the Beatles but without a great deal of showmanship or flair. Harmonies were excellent. Graphics and accompanying video were kind of corny.

reviews.title: Attended world of dance
text: I attended world of dance and scored great seats in the centre of the front orchestra. The show was amazing! The theater was smaller and cosy. There are concession stands with wine and beer. They gave a generous pour to a 9 ounce glass of wine served in a regular plastic cup. I was happy it fit in the cup holder at the seat :) .

reviews.title: The theatre with an ever changing name
text: I have come here for many performances and private events, but at times am not quite sure what theatre I am going to because of all the name changes. The theatre is very nice, great stage, good cushioned seating, roomy, good acoustics, and many great performances. Watched a comedy play on this visit. Great venue.

reviews.title: No Bad Seats
text: Staff at the box office, which is next door in the St Lawrence Centre are helpful and efficient. Seats are comfortable, unlike Scotiabank arena. All seats have a good view. Acoustics are very good. Convenient location for nearby hotels and Union Station.

reviews.title: Great Concert Venue
text: What to say about this venue. First off, I am not a huge concert attendee, so I don't have too much to compare it with. But, I found that the sound/acoustics were great. The sound was full and not brash. The seating was nice. I didn't feel too much like a sardine. :) My view was pretty great, even with the tallest man in the row directly in front of me, the way the seating is set up I could easily look around him.
The cost of refreshments was pretty high. $4.00 for water... but maybe that is average.
Overall, I enjoyed my night out at The Sony Centre.

reviews.title: Great venue for shows
text: Came for the Dora awards. Easily accessible with union station close by and many parking lots close by.
Large open theatre with 2 bars on main level.
Washrooms on lower level.
Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable seats with cup holders (yay!).
Great venue to watch a show. I sat in left orchestra and the view was fine.

reviews.title: Amazing Customer Service
text: We attended Norah Jones concert tonight, I recently had a knee injury and found it quite difficult to keep my leg straightened in my seat in the balcony area.  I decided to stand up and wait in the aisle until the concert started.  While standing there one of the ushers (Leonard, I hope I have his name correct) came up and asked if I needed help.  I explained what the problem was, he said he was going to check with management to see if there was anything they could do.  A few minutes later one of the management team came up and advised they could move us to a different seat where I could stretch my leg out.  There were actually three people in our party, he didn't  realize that originally, the new seats where only two. I advised just one seat would be fine so he took me down to the lower level and moved to to the 14th row from the stage with two seats on the aisle.  These are amazing seats and made my concert experience so much more comfortable.  I did not ask to be moved, they came to me and offered to make my attendance much more enjoyable!  Definitely above average customer service.

reviews.title: A great venue
text: A large foyer allows the space to not feel too crowded. Good acoustics and pretty good seats (a little tight for broader shoulders). In a nice neighbourhood, you can easily walk over from Union station and not worry about parking.

reviews.title: Concert Show
text: Having been here in the past, it is a nice venue for shows.
It seems to me though, in a past renovation, seats have been added, which means seating is tight on the sides. Also cup holders have been added at the seat. Very anoyinging and obtrusive.
